attributes.action: protect credit and debit cardholders from having their card taken out of view as security.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
To overcome the possible threat of staff from a business copying details read by the eye when they are in possession of a customer’s credit/debit card, I call for it to be made illegal for staff taking a card for payment to place the card out of sight of the customer.

A credit/debit card should not be taken away for use as security such as for a bar tab when at a restaurant but swiped with a payment of £0 at the start to register and full payment made later.

Businesses should be prepared to take the risk of having to track down non-payers rather than compromising the security of the customer’s identity. Customers shouldn’t have to have their security compromised for the security of the business. An Individual’s security comes before that of a business and is no excuse to keep hold of the customer’s card.

In general, it should be made illegal for all businesses taking payments to take a credit/debit card out of view of the customer as this will help prevent card details from being copied.
